author: Shannon Thaler
title: Starbucks manager who claims she was fired for being white awarded another $2.7M
description: Starbucks was ordered to pay Shannon Phillips $2.7 million, meaning the former regional manager has received a total of nearly $30 million for being wrongfully cut loose by the coffee giant.

author: Slim Randles
title: Home Country: It beats the alternative
description: Ran into Doc down at The Mule Barn the other day, so naturally we had to rid the world of about a gallon of coffee and solve the world’s problems for an hour. It is the duty of all true Americans of our age, you know. Doc said he’d been aching a little bit lately. […]

author: BusinessWorld
title: Trash to treasure: Indonesian firm turns plastic into bricks
description: JAKARTA – Ovy Sabrina fights plastic waste in Indonesia by spreading noodle packets, coffee sachets, straws and other trash around the sprawling archipelago – entombed in eco-friendly bricks. Her family knows not to stand in her way on environmental issues, especially five years ago when she came up with the idea of making bricks using […]

author: toakes
title: Dunkin’ to Launch Adult Beverages in 12 States…
description: Dunkin is expanding its drink selection at their locations in select states.  The new products will include spiked iced coffees and iced teas.  This development happens a year after Dunkin’ got together with Harpoon Brewery and their

author: Quentin Young, Colorado Newsline
title: Elections chief: Colorado and Georgia security breaches part of same 'insider threats'
description: A key component of the election subversion indictment that was unsealed Monday in Georgia is a security breach of election equipment in the Coffee County elections office — an alleged criminal episode that bears striking resemblance to a security breach that occurred in the election offices of Mesa County, Colorado. In both cases, extreme supporters of former President Donald Trump are alleged to have accessed election equipment to obtain sensitive data in pursuit of false claims that the 2020 election was rigged. In both cases the breach was facilitated by a top county election official...

author: Angela Johnson and Adriano Contreras
title: How a Coffee Brand Scaled Up Its Business & Partnered With The NFL | Securing the Bag: Part 2

author: Shira Laucharoen
title: Dunkin’ Spiked, a buzzy beverage line, will launch in late August
description: The alcoholic iced coffees and iced teas will hit stores soon.The post Dunkin’ Spiked, a buzzy beverage line, will launch in late August appeared first on Boston.com.

author: Melina Delkic
title: Iced Coffee and Flip-Flops as Europe Broils? Not So Fast, Americans.
description: As large numbers of U.S. tourists visit Europe during a record hot summer, their efforts to stay cool are running up against cultural norms.

author: Jena Greene
title: Forget the PSL, Starbucks' menu adds 3 surprise summer drinks
description: The coffee chain isn't ready to let go of summer just yet.

author: Raw Story
title: Trump ally mocked reporter's purported ignorance of Georgia law — now she's been indicted
description: An ally of former President Donald Trump once mocked Politico legal affairs reporter Kyle Cheney for his supposed ignorance of Georgia state law — but now she's facing criminal charges for her efforts in trying to overturn Trump's 2020 loss in the Peach State.As Cheney documents on Twitter, he sent an email in November 2020 to Cathy Latham, the former Coffee County GOP chair and fake Trump elector.In the email, Cheney asked Latham about the proposed fake electors scheme that at the time was in the early stages of being hatched by the former president's allies.Latham responded to Cheney's...

author: Lenny Ann Low
title: ‘It’s like a coffee degustation’: This minimalist spot in Burwood offers a bevy of curated brews, cakes and creative cafe classics
description: Devotees of the bean can order trays featuring four kinds of coffee, alongside counter sweets and snacks.
